alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northern Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 3:52PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Humboldt and northwestern Elko Counties through 430 PM PDT... At 351 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 31 miles east of McDermitt, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Humboldt and northwestern Elko Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
